Package common.communication

Class Communication

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.communication.Communication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Communication
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class for the communications between client-side to server-side Includes all the elements required to transmit a valid message that is Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Communication.ClientMessageType
      Determines the client message's type
      static class  Communication.CommunicationType
      The communication type of this communication instance QUERY_REQUEST: a client-server message for executing a single query TRANSACTION: a client-server message for multiple queries NOTIFICATION: a client-server message request for sending a notification CLIENT_SERVER_MESSAGE: a client-server message that is not a query SERVER_CLIENT_MESSAGE: a server-client message SELF: an inner-server query request
      static class  Communication.NotificationType
      Determines the notification's type
      static class  Communication.QueryType
      Determines the type of the SQL requested query
      static class  Communication.SecondaryRequest
      Determines the secondary request's type
      static class  Communication.ServerMessageType
      Determines the server message's type

      • setQueryType

        public void setQueryType​(Communication.QueryType queryType)
                  throws CommunicationException
        Determines the type of the SQL query requested
        Parameters:
        queryType - the type of the SQL query requested
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - if trying to set a QueryType where the CommunicationType is not a QUERY_REQUEST

      • setTables

        public void setTables​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tables)
        Sets the tables the SQL query will execute on
        Parameters:

      • setSelectColumns

        public void setSelectColumns​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectColumns)
        If the query is SELECT, this method sets the columns in the returened view from the database
        Parameters:
        selectColumns - a List of Strings denoting the SELECT columns

      • setWhereConditions

        public void setWhereConditions​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> whereColumns,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> whereOperators,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Object> whereValues)
        This method sets the WHERE part of the query. Limitations: whereColumns.size() must be equal to whereValues.size(), Moreover, whereOperators.size() must be equal to whereColumns.size() + whereValues.size() - 1
        Parameters:
        whereColumns - a List of Strings denoting the WHERE columns
        whereOperators - a List of Strings denoting the WHERE operators ("=", ">", "<", ">=", "<=", "!=", "AND", "OR", etc.)
        whereValues - a List of Objects denoting the values to check of each columns

      • setColumnsAndValues

        public void setColumnsAndValues​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> columns,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.Object> values)
        This method sets the columns and values (of the INSERT and SET parts)
        Parameters:
        columns - a List of String denoting the columns of SET or INSERT
        values - a List of Objects denoting the columns' values

      • setCritical

        public void setCritical​(boolean isCritical,
                        int semaphoreIndex)
        This method sets the critical section property, and the semaphore index determinig which park has to locked
        Parameters:
        isCritical -
        semaphoreIndex - the index of the requested semaphore (this is the park's index in range 0-amountOfParks)

      • combineQuery

        public java.lang.String combineQuery()
                              throws CommunicationException
        This method redirects the query creation to the specific method according to the query type
        Returns:
        a String ready for execution in the DatabaseController
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - if trying to combine a query while the Communication is not of QUERY_REQUEST type

      • combineSelectQuery

        private java.lang.String combineSelectQuery()
                                     throws CommunicationException
        This method creates and returns a SELECT query
        Returns:
        a String of a SELECT SQL query
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - if the tables or selectColumns are not included in the QUERY_REQUEST Communication

      • combineUpdateQuery

        private java.lang.String combineUpdateQuery()
                                     throws CommunicationException
        This method creates and returns a UPDATE query
        Returns:
        a String of a UPDATE SQL query
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - if the tables or columns or values are not included in the QUERY_REQUEST Communication

      • combineInsertQuery

        private java.lang.String combineInsertQuery()
                                     throws CommunicationException
        This method creates and returns a INSERT query
        Returns:
        a String of a INSERT SQL query
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - if the tables or columns or values are not included in the QUERY_REQUEST Communication

      • combineDeleteQuery

        private java.lang.String combineDeleteQuery()
                                     throws CommunicationException
        This method creates and returns a DELETE query
        Returns:
        a String of a DELETE SQL query
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - if the tables are not included in the QUERY_REQUEST Communication

      • prepareValue

        private java.lang.String prepareValue​(java.lang.Object value)
        This method gets a value object and prepares it to fit the SQL syntax
        Parameters:
        value - to prepare for the SQL syntax
        Returns:
        the prepared value

      • createWherePart

        private java.lang.String createWherePart()
                                  throws CommunicationException
        This method creates, if relevant, the WHERE part of the query, as string
        Returns:
        a String of the WHERE part of the query
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - if the amount of values is not equal to the amount of columns, or if the amount of operators does not fit the amount of columns and values

      • addRequestToList

        public void addRequestToList​(Communication request)
        This method is called in order to add a request to a list of requests to be executed as a transaction
        Parameters:
        request -

      • getRequestsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Communication> getRequestsList()
        This method returns the requests list of a transaction communication
        Returns:
        the requests list

      • getNotificationType

        public Communication.NotificationType getNotificationType()
        Returns:
        the notification type

      • setNotificationType

        public void setNotificationType​(Communication.NotificationType notificationType)
        Sets the notification type requested
        Parameters:
        notificationType -

      • getClientMessageType

        public Communication.ClientMessageType getClientMessageType()
        Returns:
        the MessageType, if the Communication is from CLIENT_SERVER_MESSAGE type

      • setClientMessageType

        public void setClientMessageType​(Communication.ClientMessageType clientMessageType)
        This method sets the MessageType
        Parameters:
        messageType - the MessageType to be set

      • getResultList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> getResultList()
        This method returns the result list (to use on the client-side), after it was inserted by the server-side. The result list is an ArrayList of Object[], denoting the view returned from a SELECT query execution.
        Returns:
        the result list

      • getQueryResult

        public boolean getQueryResult()
        This method returns the query result (true = succeed, false = failed), after it was inserted by the server-side. The result is a boolean variablem denoting the result of UPDATE/INSERT/DELETE queries.
        Returns:
        the query result

      • getServerMessageType

        public Communication.ServerMessageType getServerMessageType()
        Returns:
        the server-client type of message

      • getTransactionResult

        public boolean getTransactionResult()
        This method returns the result of the transaction
        Returns:
        true if all queries succeed, false otherwise

      • setResultList

        public void setResultList​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> resultList)
        This method sets the result list to a Communication of RESPONSE type, by the server-side to the later use of the client-side.
        Parameters:
        resultList - the result list of a SELECT query

      • setQueryResult

        public void setQueryResult​(boolean queryResult)
        This method sets the query result to a Communication of RESPONSE type, by the server-side to the later use of the client-side.
        Parameters:
        queryResult - the query result of an UPDATE/INSERT/DELETE queries

      • setServerMessageType

        public void setServerMessageType​(Communication.ServerMessageType serverMessageType)
        Sets the server-client type of message
        Parameters:
        serverMessageType -
